parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Unit Control

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Enables parts of the AI behavior that was disabled by [[disableAI]]. 
<br><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>When player switches and leaves behind AI unit, you need to enable "TeamSwitch" AI on it <tt>_unit [[enableAI]] "TeamSwitch"</tt> so that the unit continues with [[waypoints]] </value></part></template>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3 </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Since Arma 3 v1.95.145843 it is possible to return the state of the given AI flag via [[checkAIFeature]] or set it using alias command [[enableAIFeature]]</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''enableAI''' skilltype

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> skilltype: [[String]] - See [[disableAI]] for possible values.

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldierOne [[enableAI]] "Move";</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[disableAI]], [[checkAIFeature]], [[enableAIFeature]], [[vehicleMoveInfo]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
